meanings.definition: Persuading or enticing someone to do something through flattery or deception.
meanings.sent1: She inveigled her friend into sharing her toys by complimenting her.
meanings.sent2: The salesman was skilled at inveigling customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inveigled the dog into chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The magician inveigled the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox inveigled the hen out of the coop with promises of a grand adventure.

meanings.definition: Winning someone over through charm or manipulation.
meanings.sent1: He inveigled his way into the exclusive club by pretending to be a VIP.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known for inveigling voters with his charismatic speeches.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon inveigled the campers into sharing their snacks by performing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist inveigled his victims into giving him their life savings.
meanings.sent5: The charming prince inveigled the princess with his sweet words and gentle demeanor.
